title: In-Depth Analysis & Visualisations - Avito
description: In-Depth Exploratory Analysis and Visualizations - AvitoAvito is the Russia’s largest classified advertisements website. Sellers on their platform sometimes feel frustrated with both too little demand (indicating something is wrong with the product or the product listing) or too much demand (indicating a hot item with a good description was underpriced). In this competition, the aim is to predict demand for an online advertisement based on its full description (title, description, images, etc.), its context (geographically where it was posted, similar ads already posted) and historical demand for similar ads in similar contexts. With this information, Avito can inform sellers on how to best optimize their listing and provide some indication of how much interest they should realistically expect to receive. In this notebook, I have analysed the dataset shared by Avito and prepared visualizations to understand it better. Contents1. Dataset Preparation 2. Feature Engineering 3. Translating Columns 4. Dataset Snapshot        4.1. Snapshot of Training Data        4.2 Snapshot of Training Periods Data 5. Understanding the Variable Distributions        5.1 What is the Distribution of Deal Probability        5.2 Deal Probability Bins        5.3 Distribution of Parent Category        5.4 Distribution of Category        5.5 Regions and their Item Counts        5.6 Visualizing the Regions on Map        5.7 Visualizing the Cities on Map        5.8 Cities and their item counts        5.9 Param_1, Param_2, Param_3 distributions        5.10 Month Day and Week Day - Number of Items        5.11 Title Word Count, Description Word Count and their distributions        5.12 Image Top1 and User Id        5.13 Distribution of User Type        5.14 For how much Days ads are run        5.15 Top brands present in the title 6. Multi Variate Analysis        6.1 Correlation among the variables        6.2 Deal Probability by Parent Category and User Type         6.3 Deal Probability by Region and User Type        6.4 Understanding Log of Price with respect to deal probability Class        6.5 How many items are there under different Parent Category and different Deal Class        6.6 Items from different Regions and Different Deal Probability        6.7 Different Regions and the mean price of items having different deal probability        6.8 What is the Mean Price of Items having different Deal Probability and Parent Category        6.9 Deal Class values on different Week Days and their Mean Price        6.10 Different Regions, Different Day of the Week and Value of Mean Price of Items        6.11 Week Day and Region vise Value of Max Price of Items        6.12 Max value of Deal Proabability by different Regions and Day of the Week 7. Charateristics of Items having High or Low Mean Price        7.1 Mean Price of Items by Week Day and Month Day        7.2 Mean price of items by Regions and Cities        7.3 Mean Price of Items by Categories and Parent Categories        7.4 Mean Price by Count of Words present in Title and Description 8. Characteristics of Items having Very High (or Very Low) Deal Percentage        8.1 Words present in the title        8.2 Comparing all other features of Items with Low and High deal percentages        8.3 Top N-grams used in the description of items 9. Images Related with Items        9.1 Images having High Deal Probability        9.2 Images having Low Deal Probability  1. Dataset PreparationIn this section, I have included the required libraries and loaded the dataset into memory using pandas
